tracks.text: Chris Martin opens his eyes, looking directly at us.
In daylight, he lies on an blue, stained mattress, his arm resting over his head.
The twin sized mattress lies on dirty tile covered in graffitti
He lies on it, looking to the side. Around him, walls are covered in graffiti.
He convulses oddly, then un-falls up to a standing position.
He holds his left arm and stares off as teenagers bike around in reverse
On an urban street, Martin walks backwards, singing to us.
He swings over a brick wall
He walks backwards to the wall outside a laundry mat.
He walks backwards through dead leaves on an overgrown sidewalk
He leaps backwards over a step, then continues under a railroad bridge.
A basketball flies out of a man's hands.
A basketball flies up from the ground hits the rim of the hoop, then arcs to a man who catches it and lands.
A basketball flies from a bald man's hands to a goateed man, then flies straight up through a hoop.
Martin walks backwards down a sidewalk past overgrown branches.
He walks slowly along an empty railroad junction. 8 railroad track lay side by side. He makes slow steps over each rail.
From a distance, we see Martin stumbling uphill, towards a thick forest.
In the dark, Martin makes his way backwards through the forest.
He runs backwards into the darkness.
Leaves fall slowly upwards, then rapidly come together into Martin's outstretched hands. He holds a pile of leaves and looks at it.
Martin looks into the darkness, then suddenly catches a flying stick.
Black cloth lies crumpled on the ground.
Martin looks to the side, and a black jacket flies into his outstretched arm. He puts the jacket on and buttons it
Wearing the jacket, he walks backwards into a clearing.
In the clearing, a figure lies in the grass
Martin passes several feet by a woman in jeans and a black leather coat, lying on the ground, eyes closed.
Martin opens the door of a car and gets in.
He shakes his head, adjusts his jaw, then leans back, as if asleep.
The BMW begins to bounce.
Shattered glass around the woman rises up
The woman begins to rise and slowly float feet first towards the car.
The car bounces. The woman enters the car as the glass forms a windshield behind her.
The car bounces, then flies backwards. From a distance, we see the car roll up the hill.
The car rolls to a broken fence. As the car reverses through, the fence repairs itself.
The car reverses onto the bend of a curvy, country road.
The car swerves violently around a truck.
In the car, Martin laughs while driving.
He sings, as the woman in the passenger seat smiles and takes off a leather jacket.
She puts the jacket into the back seat.
She puts on her seatbelt. The two of them smile at each other as they drive through the woods.
Fade to black.
